p.s: The director uses in this scene a lot of close ups to emphasize the mixture of Starr's feelings between beeingbeing mad at Chris and beeingbeing full in love with him.
The scene opens with a close up of Chris who's doing handshakes with his homies.
In the next cut it is shown how he walks through the school highway with a bright smile on his face in a medium shot which informs the viewer that he seems to be a dude everyone likes.
The following shot shows Starr in a medium shot.
While she looks at Chris the camera zooms in to a close up to underlinesunderline that she is a bit mad at Chris.
In a POVpoint of view cam of Starr the camera tilttilts up to present how Starr sees Chris in this situation.
In the next shot we have a close up of StarrsStarr's face to present or emphasize that she is mad at Chris.
Behind her we can see Chris in aan over the shoulder shot to give information to the viewer that Chris is standing behind her.
In the following shots we get many close ups to express the feelings of the two characters in this situation.
Starr is mad at Chris because of the incident with the condom and Chris seems to be a bit disapointeddisappointed or sad about that Starr won't go further in their relashonshiprelationship.
But important to notice is that the camera is always on eye level so it can be say that nobody in this situation is dominating.

In the next important shot is another close up with which the director shows the viewer that Chris puts the kabelcable of his headphones out of his phone and everyone hears the music and it is not music just the viewer can hear.
In the following cut we have a medium shot to show that Chris is dancing/vibing to his new beat and the soroundingsurrounding that some people look at him and like how he is dancing.
Important to add here is that this shot was filmed in slow motion to emphasize that Starr likes the moment because the time slowed down.
To show that Starr now is happy is shown in a zoomed in close up.
The last shot of the scene is a last close up to present the romantic between them and they they are full in love.
As already mentioned that the director used a lot of close ups in this scene to underline the mixture of Starr's feelings.
As a result it can be said that Starr was in the beginning and very close to the end of this scene mad at Chris but at the end she forgives Chris.
